channel.title: Terraformer on Harvester manual test cases
channel.description: Recent content in Terraformer on Harvester manual test cases

item.title: Check that you can communicate with the Harvester cluster
item.description:
1. Set the KUBECONFIG env variable with the path of your kubeconfig file
  2. Try to import any resource to test the connectivity with the Harvester cluster For instance, try to import ssh-key with: terraformer import harvester -r ssh_key

Expected Results

You should see:

terraformer import harvester -r ssh_key                                                                                   
2021/08/04 15:18:59 harvester importing... ssh_key
2021/08/04 15:18:59 harvester done importing ssh_key
...

And the generated files should appear in ./generated/harvester/ssh_key/

item.title: Import and make changes to clusternetwork resource
item.description:
1. Import clusternetwork resource
terraformer import harvester -r clusternetwork
  1. Replace the provider (already explained in the installation process above)
  2. terraform plan and apply command should print “No changes.”
  3. Alter the resource and check with terraform plan then terraform apply For instance, alter the following properties: default_physical_nic, enable in the clusternetwork.tf file
  4. Check the change through either the UI or the API

Expected Results

  • Import output
terraformer import harvester -r clusternetwork
2021/08/04 15:43:25 harvester importing... clusternetwork
2021/08/04 15:43:26 harvester done importing clusternetwork
...
  • Terraform plan output
default_physical => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
enable=> Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
  • You should see the changes on the UI in the according sections

item.title: Import and make changes to image resource
item.description:
1. Import image resource terraformer import harvester -r image
  2. Replace the provider (already explained in the installation process above) terraform plan and apply command should print “No changes.”
  3. Alter the resource and check with terraform plan then terraform apply For instance, alter the following properties: description, display_name, name, namespace and url in the image.tf file
  4. Check the change through either the UI or the API

Expected Results

  • Import output
terraformer import harvester -r image
2021/08/04 16:14:52 harvester importing... image
2021/08/04 16:14:52 harvester done importing image
...
  • Terraform plan output
description => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
display_name => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
name => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
namespace => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
url => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
  • You should see the changes on the UI in the according sections

item.title: Import and make changes to network resource
item.description:
1. Import network resource terraformer import harvester -r network
  2. Replace the provider (already explained in the installation process above)
  3. terraform plan and apply command should print “No changes.”
  4. Alter the resource and check with terraform plan then terraform apply For instance, alter the following properties: name, namespace and vlan_id in the network.tf file
  5. Check the change through either the UI or the API

Expected Results

  • Import output
terraformer import harvester -r network
2021/08/04 16:14:08 harvester importing... network
2021/08/04 16:14:08 harvester done importing network
...
  • Terraform plan output
name => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
namespace => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
vlan_id => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
  • You should see the changes on the UI in the according sections

item.title: Import and make changes to ssh_key resource
item.description:
1. Import ssh_key resource terraformer import harvester -r ssh_key
  2. Replace the provider (already explained in the installation process above) terraform plan and apply command should print “No changes.”
  3. Alter the resource and check with terraform plan then terraform apply
  4. For instance, alter the following properties: name, namespace and public_key in the ssh_key.tf file
  5. Check the change through either the UI or the API

Expected Results

  • Import output
terraformer import harvester -r ssh_key
2021/08/04 16:14:36 harvester importing... ssh_key
2021/08/04 16:14:37 harvester done importing ssh_key
...
  • Terraform plan output
name => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
namespace => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
public_key => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
  • You should see the changes on the UI in the according sections

item.title: Import and make changes to virtual machine resource
item.description:
1. Import virtual machine resource terraformer import harvester -r virtualmachine
  2. Replace the provider (already explained in the installation process above)
  3. terraform plan and apply command should print “No changes.”
  4. Alter the resource and check with terraform plan then terraform apply
  5. For instance, alter the following properties: cpu, memory, name in the virtualmachine.tf file
  6. Check the change through either the UI or the API

Expected Results

  • Import output
terraformer import harvester -r virtualmachine
2021/08/04 16:15:08 harvester importing... virtualmachine
2021/08/04 16:15:09 harvester done importing virtualmachine
...
  • Terraform plan output
cpu => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
memory => Plan: 0 to add, 1 to change, 0 to destroy.
name => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
namespace => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
  • You should see the changes on the UI in the according sections

item.title: Import and make changes to volume resource
item.description:
1. Import volume resource terraformer import harvester -r volume
  2. Replace the provider (already explained in the installation process above) terraform plan and apply command should print “No changes.”
  3. Alter the resource and check with terraform plan then terraform apply For instance, alter the following properties: name, namespace in the volume.tf file
  4. Check the change through either the UI or the API

Expected Results

  • Import output
terraformer import harvester -r volume
2021/08/04 16:15:29 harvester importing... volume
2021/08/04 16:15:29 harvester done importing volume
...
  • Terraform plan output
name => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
namespace => Plan: 1 to add, 0 to change, 1 to destroy.
  • You should see the changes on the UI in the according sections
